Posts.Content: nwsailor wrote: Hello everyone, I am 52 years old, fit, work out a lot.  I was diagnosed by lumpectomy 11/27 with non-invasive DCIS, stage 0, grade 3.  The path report said " 1 cm lesion,solid and cribiform types, with areas of central necrosis" , intermediate to high nuclear grade" is this comedo?  I know someone that had DCIS, had a lumpectomy in '05 without rad but + tamoxifen with recurrance in 14 mos with invasive breast cancer with 6 nodes positive.  I am perimenopausal, still have periods every 28-30 days and no hot flashes.  Am I crazy to think about a double mastectomy?  They say my chances of recurrance are higher than the 20% usually quoted, and I have been under "close survelliance" with mammograms every 6 mos for the last 2 yrs for microcalcifications.  My husband and I just bought a sailboat to go around the world for 1-3 yrs, we are experienced sailors.  I just want to be done with this, I can't imagine being someplace in the South Pacific next year and finding a lump; I want it behind me, am I crazy?  What do you all think? Dx 11/7/2007, DCIS, 1cm, Stage 0, Grade 3, ER+/PR+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Am I making the right choice? nwsailor nwsailor
